perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement shall be effective as of the date first stated above and shall continue for a term of three (3) years, unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement (the "Term"); provided, however, that PrimeCall may elect to terminate this Agreement, upon thirty (30) days' written notice, at any time from and after the time that collectively RSL Communications, Ltd. and/or its Affiliates holds less than fifty percent (50%) of the voting control of DeltaThree's outstanding shares.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement shall be effective as of the date first stated above and shall continue for a term of three (3) years, unless terminated earlier in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement (the "Duration"); provided, however, that PrimeCall may elect to terminate this Agreement, upon ninety (90) days' written notice, at any time from and after the time that collectively RSL Communications, Ltd. and/or its Affiliates holds less than fifty percent (50%) of the voting control of DeltaThree's outstanding shares.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Term' has been replaced with 'Duration', but the agreement later still references the original 'Term' potentially creating confusion about the agreed-upon time period. Additionally, the notice period for termination has been changed from thirty to ninety days, leading to direct conflict and uncertainty on termination clauses.

perturbation.original_text: PrimeCall shall negotiate and contract on behalf of DeltaThree to out-source customer service for users of the Calling Card. DeltaThree shall reimburse PrimeCall for all customer service expenses directly related to users of the Calling Card. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the level of customer service shall be subject to the approval of DeltaThree.
perturbation.changed_text: PrimeCall shall negotiate and contract on behalf of DeltaThree to out-source customer support for users of the Calling Card. DeltaThree shall reimburse PrimeCall for all customer assistance expenses directly related to users of the Calling Card. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the quality of client support shall be subject to the approval of DeltaThree.
perturbation.explanation: Here the key term 'customer service' is changed to 'customer support', 'customer assistance', and 'client support', creating ambiguity whether PrimeCall is supposed to be outsourcing customer service, customer support, customer assistance, or client support. This creates uncertainty around PrimeCall's obligations. Moreover, the phrase 'level of customer service' is altered to the 'quality of client support' introducing a different standard that leads to enforcement uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: All notices or other communications required or permitted hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed given or delivered (i) when delivered personally or by private courier, (ii) when actually delivered by registered or certified United States mail, return receipt requested and postage prepaid or (iii) when sent by telecopy (provided, that, it is simultaneously electronically confirmed), addressed as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: All notifications or other correspondence required or permitted hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed given or delivered (i) when delivered personally or by private courier, (ii) when actually delivered by recorded or certified United States mail, return receipt requested and postage prepaid or (iii) when sent by facsimile (provided, that, it is simultaneously electronically confirmed), addressed as follows:
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'notices' is changed to 'notifications', 'communications' is changed to 'correspondence' and 'telecopy' is changed to 'facsimile', while 'registered' is changed to 'recorded'. The alteration between 'notices' and 'notifications' opens up questions about whether formal legal demands meet the standard, while the alteration between 'communications' and 'correspondence' opens up whether informal discussions are applicable. Similarly, while 'telecopy' and 'facsimile' are technically synonymous, their interchangeable use causes confusion as to whether the contract requires a specific format and can lead to confusion for international parties.
